section.heading: Incorporation; name.
section.text: N. P. Chipman, J. P. Newman, B. Peyton Brown, John A. L. Morrell, Mathew G. Emery, Joseph H. Bradley, senior, William R. Woodward, E. Whittlesey, Warren Choate, Andrew B. Duvall, A. S. Solomons, W. G. Metzerott, Alexander R. Shepperd, S. J. Bowen, H. M. Sweeney, Benjamin E. Gittings, William Tucker, Charles H. Lane, W. Burris, William McPheeters, E. F. N. Faehtz, J. L. Gatchel, John R. Elvans, Edgar I. Booraem, L. H. Hopkins, Thomas P. Keene, W. D. Blackford, F. H. Day, J. Sayles Brown, William Lanborn, E. L. Corbin, N. A. West, John R. Arrison, W. A. Farlee, Benjamin F. Fuller, Robert A. Slater, Alonzo Bell, A. T. Kinney, John J. Jett, A. M. Scott, A. C. White, A. E. Newton, A. S. Taylor, William H. Rowe, Robert Reyburn, W. H. Slater, John C. Parker, William J. Wilson, S. S. Baker, A. Jones, S. R. Bond, John F. Cook, D. W. Anderson, George A. Hall, Charles H. Moulton, John Edwin Mason, Allison Nailor, junior, David A. Burr, T. C. Grey, R. H. Marsh, Thomas Perry, George F. Gulick, and Theodore F. Gatchel, all of the District of Columbia, and such other persons as were associated with them in conformity to this chapter, and their successors duly chosen, were constituted and created a body corporate in the District of Columbia, to be known as the Washington Humane Society.

annoGroup.heading: Section References
annoGroup.annotation: This section is referenced in § 44-1507 and § 44-1511.

section.heading: Society to have certain officers.
section.text: The officers of said corporation shall consist of a president, 5 vice-presidents, 1 secretary, 1 treasurer, an executive committee of 11 members, and such other officers as shall from time to time seem necessary to this Society.

section.heading: Officers to be chosen from members.
section.text: The foregoing officers shall be chosen from among the members of the Society.

section.heading: Bylaws.
section.text: The said Society, for fixing the terms of admission of its members, for the government of the same, for the election, changing, and altering the officers above named, and for the general regulation and management of its affairs, shall have power to form a code of bylaws, not inconsistent with the laws of the District of Columbia, or of the United States, which code, when formed and adopted at a regular meeting, shall, until modified or rescinded, be equally binding as this chapter upon the Society, its officers, and members.

section.heading: Police to arrest law violators at request of member; evidence of membership.
section.text: Members of the Metropolitan Police force of the District of Columbia, upon application of a member of the Washington Humane Society who has viewed a violation of a law or regulation of the District for the prevention of cruelty to animals, shall arrest the offending party without a warrant, and take him before the Superior Court of the District of Columbia for trial. Proper evidence of membership to a police officer shall be the exhibition of a badge or certificate of membership in the Society.

annoGroup.heading: Cross References
annoGroup.annotation: Animal cruelty, warrantless arrest, fighting or baiting, see § 22-1009.
Animal cruelty, warrantless arrest, notice to owner, see § 22-1004.

annoGroup.heading: Section References
annoGroup.annotation: This section is referenced in § 22-1004 and § 22-1009.

section.heading: Disposition of fines.
section.text: One half of all the fines collected through the instrumentality of the Society or its agents, for violations of such laws shall accrue to the benefit of said Society.

annoGroup.heading: Cross References
annoGroup.annotation: Animal cruelty, fines and penalties, disposition, see § 22-1006.

section.heading: Provisions effective throughout District.
section.text: The provisions of §§ 44-1501 to 44-1507 shall be general within the boundaries of the District of Columbia.

section.heading: Power to alter, amend or repeal provisions.
section.text: Congress shall have power to alter, amend, or repeal §§ 44-1501 to 44-1507 at any time.
